title: Taming the Red Swamp
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Agricultural chemicals
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Grasses - Australia

Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Crops and soils
description: A swamp was formed when sand shaped a land bridge between Wilson's Promontory and the mainland. Shows the draining and cultivating of the Red Swamp, the addition of chemicals to the original peat, and the sowing of a seed mixture of several grasses and clovers. Dairy cattle now feed here on some of the best red clover in the State.
